title: Hull 2017 UK City of Culture live: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: live updates from hull 's year as uk city of culture .
this page is updated with stories , videos and more as they are made .
scroll back down the page to see what 's happened so far in 2017 .

documents.title: weekly guide to what 's on - 26th january
text: weekly guide to what 's on - 26th january

documents.title: kofi vs kids : homemade instruments at hull central library
text: kofi vs kids : homemade instruments at hull central library

documents.title: kofi 's failed cold mountain audition
text: kofi 's failed cold mountain audition

documents.title: hull 's brass band spectacular
text: on saturday hull city hall played host to a brass band spectacular as part of the city of culture celebrations .
i went along to find out what 's so special about brass band music and the culture surrounding it .
the eyms and brighouse and rastrick bands will return to hull city hall in january 2018 .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: brass band spectacular at hull city hall
text: brass band spectacular at hull city hall

documents.title: listen : the moment grimmy made the big weekend announcement
text: this is the moment nick grimshaw announced hull as the host for the 2017 big weekend on his radio one breakfast show :

documents.title: big weekend : kings of leon
text: they 're one of the biggest rock bands in the world and they 're coming to east yorkshire in may .
the followill boys are now seven albums in and hot off the back of latest lp , walls , they 're looking forward to performing for their fans in hull :
looking forward to seeing you in hull for radio 1 's big weekend at the end of the may .
huge thanks to radio 1 for leading the charge in helping us get our music to our fans , its going to be a great show , ca n't wait ! ''

documents.title: big weekend : 'hull is the place to be '
text: radio 1 's big weekend is coming to hull as part of the city of culture celebrations and has been planned alongside the hull 2017 team .
martin green , the director hull uk city of culture 2017 , says they 're thrilled :
bringing this major national event with some of the biggest names in the music industry is a massive coup for the city and confirms its growing international profile as the place to be . ''

documents.title: big weekend : ok it 's not in hull
text: a few people have been asking about the fact radio 1 's big weekend is n't technically within the hull boundary .
it 's actually in skirlaugh , 10 miles north east of hull .
since when has burton constable been in hull ? ''
why could n't it have been held at kc stadium or lightstream stadium ?
words fail me . ''
burton constable is not hull is it ? ''
organisers say they spent months looking at possible venues and found there was nowhere in hull that could fit an event of this size .
they needed space to fit 50,000 music fans , several stages and camping , so burton constable , with it 's 300 acres of land was the perfect choice .
all the details , including buses and transport to the site will be announced over the coming months .

documents.title: the pop-up art gallery run by primary school kids
text: the pop-up art gallery run by primary school kids

documents.title: humberside fire and rescue launch city of culture engine
text: hull 2017 , the team behind the city of culture , have teamed up with humberside fire and rescue service to create what they 've called a `` unique head-turning fully wrapped fire engine '' .
the brand new engine will form part of the round the clock emergency service cover and will first be housed at east hull , before moving to the new hull central fire station on spring street .
it will be fully operational , but will also feature at community and cultural events throughout the year .
like the blade , we have kept this engine as our little secret for a number of weeks and hope that the people of hull appreciate our small contribution to what will be a great year for hull . ''
author: Folarin Sagaya
BBC Local Live, Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: city of culture : what 's on ?
text: with crowds queuing outside hull 's museums and concerts selling out , you 'd think we 'd be running out of things to do in the city of culture .
but fear not , here 's my guide to some cultural activities to keep you busy over the coming week .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: weekly guide to what 's on - 19th january
text: weekly guide to what 's on - 19th january

documents.title: no planning permission for blade artwork
text: no planning permission for blade artwork

documents.title: art installation lights up council estate
text: coloured lights have been installed in blocks of flats on a hull housing estate as part of an arts project for uk city of culture 2017 .
the work called `` i wish to communicate with you '' was designed by artist silvio palladino who worked with people living on great thornton street near the city centre .
residents chose the coloured filter to be installed on the lights outside their flat .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: the story behind hull 's brightly coloured tower blocks
text: the story behind hull 's brightly coloured tower blocks

documents.title: estate gets lit up for city of culture
text: estate gets lit up for city of culture

documents.title: traditional cream phone boxes make a comeback in hull
text: the famous cream telephone boxes are unique to the city of hull .
but as many now use mobile phones , people stopped using them and dozens were removed .
however , they 're making a come back around the city for the year of culture .
author: Kate Sweeting
Reporter for BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : three reasons to visit the ferens art gallery
text: the ferens art gallery​ is open again !
and as we 've reported already this morning there were record number of visitors over the weekend .
10,000 people walked through the gallery 's doors .
here are my three great reasons to visit .
to see more city of culture videos and for more information , have a look at our website here .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: ferens gallery celebrates after successful weekend
text: hull 's ferens art gallery is celebrating one of its most successful weekends ever .
10,000 visitors passed through , with 6,000 on saturday and another 4,000 on sunday .
the building re-opened to the public on friday after a multi-million pound investment .
the maritime museum also had to turn people away from its bowhead whales exhibit , telling visitors after 15:00 on saturday there was no more room .
hull museums say they were getting more than 1,000 visitors an hour for the exhibit .
another amazing day with close to 4000 visitors , bringing the total for the weekend to 10,000 ! !
congratulations .
hope it continues .
popped in on sat , great place to visit , gon na call back again soon # lovehull # hull2017 # cityofculture
congratulations .
spent a very enjoyable couple of hours there today .
very impressive .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live, Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: made in hull - 'it reminded people where they came from '
text: the chairman of the group which awarded hull the title of city of culture 2017 says the year has got off to a great start .
and the opening event 'made in hull ' captured people imaginations .
brookside and hollyoaks creator phil redmond says so far hull has been more impressive than londonderry in 2013 and liverpool 's year as european capital of culture in 2008 .
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: plaques to honour hull 's 100 heroes
text: hull residents have nominated 100 people to be recognised for their contribution to the city .
the names will be honoured with plaques across the city as part of hull hosting the city of culture arts festival .
plaques already unveiled feature the city 's first female doctor and two men who sailed on captain scott 's first journey to antarctica .
the new list of nominees include trevor bolder , who will join fellow musician mick ronson in getting a plaque .
the pair played with david bowie in the spiders from mars in the 1970s .
the plaques will be unveiled throughout the year .
author: Stuart Harratt
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 3 reasons to visit ferens art gallery
text: the ferens art gallery is back open and i 've got 3 great reasons why you should visit !
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

text: aled jones is in town filming a special hull episode of songs of praise .
here 's what he had to say about the uk city of culture :

documents.title: listen : artist behind 'blade ' explains his motivation
text: everyone 's talking about the new art installation in the centre of hull .
the 246ft ( 75m ) wind turbine blade installed yesterday was conceived by artist nayan kulkarni .
it 's been created for look up , a programme of temporary artworks created for the city 's public spaces .

documents.title: listen : city of culture 'made in hull ' a huge success
text: hull 's city of culture team say the first week has been a great success after revealing that more than 340,000 people visited made in hull .
the exhibition was the opening event of city of culture year and ran from new year 's day until saturday .
giles lives in the city centre and says the first week of 2017 has been great for the city :

documents.title: listen : 'everyone knew the value as a surprise '
text: a new art installation which today spends its first full day in hull 's queen victoria square was kept under wraps for months by a handful of people connected with hull city of culture .
the 246ft long ( 75m ) , 28 tonne ( 28,449kg ) siemens wind turbine blade is part of the `` look up '' city of culture arts programme .
sam hunt is from look up and says keeping it a secret made blade even more special and a genuine surprise for the city
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: listen : city of culture chief reacts to huge numbers for 'made in hull '
text: hull 's city of culture opening event proved to be one of the uk 's top attractions last week with more than 340,000 visitors .
figures from city of culture show made in hull had more visitors than the science museum , natural history museum and the british museum .
chief executive of hull 2017 , martin green says it was a huge success :
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: more of 'blade '
text: in case you 've not been able to see it just yet , here are a few photos of 'blade ' - the art installation currently in hull 's queen victoria square .

text: i spoke to former winner of the apprentice , michelle dewberry , earlier .
she defended her home city after the sun newspaper 's negative coverage of the city of culture earlier in the week by taking a journalist from the newspaper on a guided tour .
have a gander at this :

BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: any burning questions for burnsy ?
text: tune your radios now !
we 're broadcasting live from hymers college in hull tonight .
it 's because the bbc radio 4 programme any questions is coming from there this evening as part of the city of culture year .
david burns will be broadcasting from 19:00 ahead of a simulcast with jonathan dimbleby .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: listen : dimbleby on life as a broadcaster and writer
text: i 've been talking to bbc radio 4 's any questions presenter jonathan dimbleby about hull ahead of his visit to the city of culture .
a special hull edition of the programme comes from hymers college tonight .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: muse longer at hull museums
text: new museum opening hours have been announced .
our museums will be open longer on sundays during 2017 !
starting from this week they 'll be open from 11.00am-4.30pm
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: visitors flock to see made in hull
text: organisers say around 150,000 people have visited hull for the opening events of the uk city of culture .
the year-long celebrations started with a fireworks display beside the humber on new year 's day .
they 've continued with a week-long light show around the city centre called 'made in hull ' .
visit britain has also named hull as a top visitor destination for 2017 .
author: Andy Marsters
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : my mystery night out
text: i pot lucked out the other night !
see what i got up to at früit :
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: the name 's levy , peter levy ; licence to report the news !
text: quentin budworth 's hullywood icons series just got even better .
it 's peter as 007 !
check out look north 's front man posing here as sean connery 's james bond in dr no by hull marina .
i love it !
hear peter telling andy comfort all about the experience on bbc radio humberside .
you can also see a short film on the making of peter as 007 on bbc look north 's facebook page .
author: Clare Crooks
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: exhibition marks hull 's charter history
text: exhibition marks hull 's charter history

documents.title: pot luck : kofi 's mystery night out
text: pot luck : kofi 's mystery night out

documents.title: making waves in the marine art world
text: a series of marine themed art installations will be displayed at the deep in hull this year .
the first is by mandy barker , an award-winning photographic artist whose work involving marine plastic debris has received global recognition .
this one is called soup : burnt
born in hull , her recently recognised work was originally inspired by visits to spurn point and will be on show throughout january and february .
this one is penalty : the world .
click here to see more examples of mandy 's work .

i am really proud to have the opportunity to exhibit at such a relevant venue as the deep - one of the most spectacular aquariums in the world , in my home town of hull , for the opening exhibition for the uk city of culture 2017 , returning to the place where my work began . ''

documents.title: take a look at hull 's birth certificate !
text: hull 's original documents , dating as far back as the thirteenth century , are on show at hull history centre .
the charters exhibition is officially launched tonight as part of the made in hull programme .
city archivist martin taylor says they document hugely significant parts of hull 's history .
it really is something , a real connection with the city 's past to see our birth certificate , the 1299 charter .
the original medieval parchment dated 1 april 1299 which brought what we now know as the city of hull into being . ''
our first @ twitterid exhibition - uses the charters to show how the people of hull were granted privileges , rights & responsibilities
hi , can i ask which charter this is and can i use it on the bbc news website please ?
of course - queen mary ( dated 1553 ) it is the most decorated of the city charters , the original is on display in the exhibition
thanks
author: Clare Crooks
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: challenge hull
text: people are creating self-portraits as the first in a series of weekly challenges launches in hull .
here are the efforts of our breakfast show and it 's true , carl wheatley 's head really is that big !
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: listen : challenge hull by the seaside !
text: have a listen to this !
our james piekos enlists the help of a dog walker in bridlington for the first weekly city of culture creative challenge .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: have you done this week 's challenge yet ?
text: have you done this week 's challenge yet ?

documents.title: masterpieces on show in city of culture
text: art by some of the most prominent great masters , including michelangelo , matisse and rembrandt , are on show in hull as it embarks on its year as the latest uk city of culture .
lines of thought is a free exhibition of 70 line drawings spanning more than 500 years from the british museum 's prestigious collection .
leonardo da vinci , dürer , degas , rubens , monet , cezanne and bridget riley are also featured .
it runs until 28 february .
prof glenn burgess , acting vice-chancellor of the university of hull where the exhibition is held , said it could be `` the single greatest gathering of artistic talent ever seen in hull '' .

documents.title: a whale of a time
text: how do you get a 110-tonne whale into a room ?
if you head to hull 's maritime museum you 'll find out the answer .
but if you ca n't wait , here 's a sneaky peak :

documents.title: so what next for city of culture ?
text: made in hull , a massive fireworks display - but what now ?
there are plenty more of things happening for city of culture .
our face of hull 2017 kofi smiles has a rundown of what you can enjoy this week :

documents.title: do n't miss made in hull
text: yes , it may have already started .
yes , thousands of people have already been .
so , do you really want to be the person who has n't seen it ?
made in hull is running all week - and is a spectacular light and audio show that highlights our city 's history but brings it bang up-to-date !
watch our guide to what 's on where below :

documents.title: hull 2017 : goodnight , from the city of culture
text: we have heard several people saying they were `` proud of their city '' tonight , and it 's difficult to argue with that .
only 364 more days of this for the city to look forward to !
you can find more details on upcoming hull 2017 events here .
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: hull 2017 : four-year build-up ends
text: hull is the second city to be given uk city culture status , following derry-londonderry in 2013 .
the city came on top in a shortlist including dundee , leicester and swansea bay .
the new year 's day events have launched a programme which includes an array of work and artists - there 's more information on what the year has in store here .

documents.title: in with a bang : 'fantastic start ' to city of culture year
text: here 's a quick snippet of the in with a bang display .
a crowd of 25,000 saw it from hull marina , but i 'm sure many others from miles around probably enjoyed it too !
the finale of the fireworks that celebrated the start of hull 's year as uk city of culture .
# hull2017
@ twitterid i have always said us northerners can put a fine good show on , , well done hull proud to be yorkshire lass
agree from one yorkshire lass to another .
x
wow , that was absolutely amazing .
well done hull .
looked pretty good stood on the south bank too !
bread and circuses ?

documents.title: happy hour in hull as fireworks wow crowds
text: it was billed as a fireworks display to better london 's new year 's eve event , and it certainly did n't disappoint .
due to start at 20:17 , it actually got going five minutes ( or is that years ) late at 20:22 , but i 'm sure no-one cares .
the housemartins track 'happy hour ' soundtracked some of the display , and that probably sums it up .

documents.title: in with a bang : from the other side of the humber
text: sarah sanderson has tweeted this view from the other side of the humber , looks to have been a good view for north lincolnshire too !
a snapshot of # inwithabang # hull2017 from the banks of the # humber estuary in new holland # northlincolnshire
ah !
wondered what it looked like from lincs !
thanks sarah .
happy new year to you .
it was a good turnout on the south side !
wishing you a very happy 2017 as well
looks like a lot of fun !
happy new year : trust yours is culture-packed !
lovely to hear from you !
wishing you a very happy 2017 also .
@ twitterid what a waste of money that money could have gone to a charity for what they paid for the fireworks

documents.title: breakingin with a bang fills sky with colour
text: in with a bang , a spectacular fireworks display to mark the start of hull 's year as city of culture , begins at the city 's marina .

documents.title: in with a bang : live streaming of the event
text: in with a bang : live streaming of the event
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: the thousands volunteering for hull 2017
text: more than 3,000 people have applied to become volunteers to help make hull 's year as uk city of culture a success .
organisers said 1,000 volunteers had been trained and they hoped to recruit a total of 4,000 throughout the year .
volunteers will help greet visitors and assist during events , including the turner prize and a concert by paul heaton and jacqui abbott .

documents.title: arrivals and departures at hull 's the deep
text: art installation 'arrivals and departures ' has been projected onto the deep aquarium in hull this evening .
hull 2017 chief executive and director martin green said it was `` all about the people who have arrived and departed from this port city '' .

documents.title: in with a bang : tonight 's firework vital statistics
text: in with a bang : tonight 's firework vital statistics

documents.title: in with a bang : display due to begin
text: organisers are asking those with tickets to the fireworks to head for their allocated gate at hull marina .
if you are n't one of the lucky ones with tickets , the whole display will be streamed here and on bbc look north 's facebook page .
it 's also going to be featured on the bbc news channel .
if you 're in hull city centre with tickets to the firework display , please make your way to your allocated gate .
goodluck guys # cityofculture2017
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: getting in the
text: if hull 2017 hopes to get people involved in the city of culture then it 's got off to a good start .

and there 's nowhere better to get involved than a pop-up photo studio in the shadow of the tidal barrier , where people can have their photos taken before seeing themselves in instant artworks projected ( using a bicycle-mounted projector ) on the wall .
author: Ian Youngs
Entertainment and Arts Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: in with a bang : gates open to crowds
text: crowds at hull marina waiting for the fireworks are listening to the tunes of landlady linda , who is armed with two ipods and a selection of dancefloor fillers .
i hope you have remembered to bring a charger cable , linda .

documents.title: hull 2017 : what does the crowd think ?
text: the bbc 's kofi smiles has been wandering around the city to get the reactions of those experiencing the first event of hull 2017 .
here 's his short report .
initial reactions to # madeinhull seem pretty positive !
@ twitterid reports from # hull2017 's jaw-dropping opening event .
pretty positive ?
it was amazing and i 'd recommend anyone to go see it .
# hull2017 # cityofculture2017
i 'm not going to deny that david !
i was so blown away i didnt get any of the fireworks !
it was beyond anything i hoped it would be .
all involved should feel very proud .
# hull2017 # cityofculture2017
aye those @ twitterid somehow need to find a way to take a day off for their hard work !
and how do you feel ?
it was genuinely incredible and moving .
well done to everyone involved

documents.title: no humber bridge access for 'in with a bang '
text: people hoping to watch tonight 's fireworks display will not be able to use the humber bridge as a viewing platform .
managers of the humber bridge said it does not have the resource to manage a large number of people for the in with a bangundefined display .
the bridge 's east footpath will be closed until 20:30 gmt on 1 january .

documents.title: gig of a lifetime for pub dj
text: a hull landlady is about to have a special evening , as she dj 's to 25,000 people in the city .
linda from the bonny boat pub will be spinning her favourite numbers at the fireworks event .
she 's used to an audience the fraction of the size of this one - no pressure !
author: Colin Paterson
Entertainment Correspondent, BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: 'in with a bang ' : weather looking clear
text: if you 're one of the 25,000 heading to hull marina to watch the fireworks display at 20:17 gmt , it might be worth bringing a hat and scarf .
according to bbc weather , it 's going to be a cool four degrees - but any rain should hold off until at least 22:00 .
hope i have n't jinxed it .
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: futtock shrouds , anybody ?
text: not sure if these officially count as artworks , but the illuminated words that have been installed on the street on scale lane staith as part of the recent road improvements are intriguing .
after some investigation , it turns out they all refer to parts of ships .
apparently .
author: Ian Youngs
Entertainment and Arts Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: made in hull : striking images of packed square
text: some excellent images are now coming through of queen victoria square as the made in hull projection show has its fourth screening .
dozens of art installations are open around the city , with the night concluding with a fireworks display called 'in with a bang ' at 20:17 gmt .
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: hull 's first baby of 2017
text: meet hull 's first baby of the year .
lincoln 's footprint will go into a huge artwork along with one from every baby born in the city of culture during the celebrations .

documents.title: we are hull : send in your images
text: here 's a spectacular image of made in hull 's climax as thousands of people watch on .
send me your images of tonight 's projections and fireworks on twitter and on email at tom.airey @ bbc.co.uk , i 'm keen to feature them on our live page .
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: experience the kcom stadium roar
text: over at zebedee 's yard , an audio show is taking place simulating the deafening roar which greets hull city 's players when they walk out at the kcom stadium .
i 'm assured that all the featured chants are family-friendly .
zebedee 's yard has been turned into an audio show designed to make you feel like you 've walked on to the pitch at the kcom stadium # hull2017
@ twitterid it was a touch loud for my daughter but the fisherman 's memorial looked great .
# 2017hull

documents.title: made in hull : projections tell city 's story
text: as dusk passes , the projections on hull 's landmarks are really standing out now .
here 's a great video of the view in queen victoria square :
made in hull and city of culture has officially started with an amazing display in queen victoria square

documents.title: made in hull : from maritime history to football glory
text: the projections in the square have gone from the city 's deep connections with the sea to hull city 's return to football 's premier league last year .
it 's eclectic to say the least !
70 years of hull 's history in play !
# hull2017 # hull2017baby
a whole 70 years , what about the other 630+ years ?

documents.title: made in hull : animation fills the deep
text: the made in hull projections continue over at the city 's aquarium , as the deep is covered in stop-frame animations .
# madeinhull is underway and @ twitterid is the perfect canvas for this stop-frame animation .
original music by terry dunn @ twitterid

documents.title: made in hull : view from queen victoria square
text: made in hull : view from queen victoria square
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakingcity of culture celebrations get started
text: the countdown ends , with made in hull officially marking the start of hull 's year as uk city of culture .
the opening projections in the square include underwater shots of boat propellers and some airborne images of local hero amy johnson .
johnson became the first woman to fly solo to australia , landing in darwin on 24 may 1930 after 19 and a half days .

documents.title: made in hull : a city 's story in light and sound
text: the 2017 city of culture events starts with projection and soundscape spectacular made in hull .
directed by filmmaker sean mcallister , the display aims to transform some of the city 's most iconic buildings by using them as a canvas for huge projections .
it aims to take viewers on a journey through almost 100 years of hull 's history .

documents.title: made in hull : countdown clock appears
text: it 's now beginning to darken , so the countdown is now officially on .
good things come to those who wait , etc .
look north ( eyl )
looknorthbbc
this countdown clock has just appeared on the ferens art gallery # hull2017
this countdown clock has just appeared on the ferens art gallery # hull2017

documents.title: made in hull : 25-minute delay on start time
text: we 're hearing the delay to the start of made in hull is likely to be about 25 minutes .
bad light stops play in cricket , but it 's a different story when it comes to light projection !
caroline brockelbank
cbrockelbank
city of culture volunteer saying it will be delayed by 20/25 mins because it 's too light # madeinhull # hull2017
city of culture volunteer saying it will be delayed by 20/25 mins because it 's too light # madeinhull # hull2017
@ twitterid what 's 25 minutes .
the bridge over castle street has been delayed by 3 years
pppppp

documents.title: not quite dark enough for opening event
text: crowds gathering for the city of culture opening event .
told we 're going to have to wait for it to get dark to get started # hull2017
always the best way to view hull eh .
in the dark
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull 2017 : get in touch with our live page
text: are you one of the fortunate 25,000 attending the huge fireworks display tonight ?
what do you think becoming city of culture will do for hull ?
i would love to hear from you and see your # hull2017 - you can email me at tom.airey @ bbc.co.uk or send me a tweet ( @ tom airey ) .

documents.title: hull city of culture 2017 : here we go !
text: as heads only start to clear after the new year 's eve festivities , it 's time for another party as hull becomes city of culture 2017 .
we 've got an afternoon of dramatic projections and art installations to look forward to , followed by a fireworks display aiming to be the most spectacular the city has ever seen .
we 're here to bring you the best photos , videos and interviews from the day , and you can get in touch too .
it 's shaping up to be a memorable year .
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online
